reviews.reviewTitle: Nice Air Fryer and Easy to Use!
reviews.reviewText: Got this for my wife as heard from a friend of us that how good Air Fryer is to use on cooking with less or no oil need to add. As our kids love to eat deep fried foods so I guess having an Air Fryer might help my wife especially for cutting less on using oil to cook. So we just got it few days ago and this is our first Air Fryer so we just try something basic. We have tried to use it in the morning for cooking some bacon which we did not use any oil at all; set it to 350F and cook for 13 minutes then we got some crispy bacon for the kids. For dinner we have some chicken legs which we simply added a little bit of seasoning and a bit of corn oil then set the Air Fryer to preset of cooking chicken leg and then 20 minutes later we have some very good chicken legs. The chicken skins were very crispy but inside the meat were very tender. So far I am giving it a 5 stars and will try to use this to cook some other dishes later on since it comes with a cook book so we can try more.

This air fryer is awesome! Really easy to use and easy to clean. I don't like cooking meat indoors because of the smoke and grease that gets everywhere. This air fryer does not smoke and grease does not escape. This night I received my air fryer, I made the most amazing Pork chops and popcorn chicken that were so tender and moist inside, My husband and I both love so much. It's delicious and important things is Indoor air is clean !!!
Everything I have made so far has come out very well cooked and delicious. It's also very fast. I have no complaints so far and I'm very glad I got this air fryer.

I have never tried an air fryer before this one, but was amazed with the product so far. first off, set up took only a few minutes to get going and i was off and cooking. the air fryer comes with a book with several recipes and i found even more online(including youtude videos). i tried making steak the first time,and it came out great. nice,medium rate steaks in 12 minutes without setting off my fire alarm(as usually happens from all the smoke) and it tasted great. clean up was nice and quick as the fryer basket easily detaches with a single button press from the main pan.Summary, happily recommend this to my friends and looking forward to trying out new recipes!

With exceptional new technologies, jets of hot air bursts inside the hot air fryer and cooks the food.
Many people are still unaware of this wonder air fryer, which actually has helped countless people eat healthy and tasty food every day. Air fryer, the healthy frying option, cooks food in hot air rather than oil, so that food tastes just as good but has way less calories and cholesterol than deep fried food.For my family, I pruchased one.
It is a fascinating procedure, and it results in food fried in little or no oil whatsoever. That makes this product perfect for the times when one needs to reduce the calorie count of a particular dish while not compromising on the taste of it.
Apart from cooking in virtually no oil, another very big benefit of using this hot air fryer, the healthy frying option, is the reduced usage of fuel.
My airfryers consume a low amount of electric while cooking, and it has precise instructions.When it comes to electricity, even the usage of that is significantly lower than cooking in oil.
And it is definitely easy to clean up. They can be cleaned with minimum effort, and storing them is no major hardship. There are control display screen which can adjust both the time as well as the temperature. So, if you want to cook something for 5 minutes at 200 degree centigrade, then these screen can be used to adjust the same.
With the airfryer, grilling, frying and baking becomes very easy, and new experiments about recipes can be made. Its design has been made that prevents sudden shock or power-related issues. Also, this opens up my world of possibilities who love to drink and eat. There is a nonstick pan inside the fryer which can be washed pretty easily and the rest of the fryer is dishwasher safe most of the times. And it is also disallows the concept of adding oil which has been the reason why many people can follow the recipes so easily, and accurately, which would be also very heart-friendly and cholesterol conscious.
This way, I can “deep fry” food everyday and eat it without feeling guilty about eating too many calories, or eat the same oil in which many batches of fries have been fried. The oil is harmful, as after frying for 10 hours or so carcinogenic properties develop in cooking oil left heating over high heat. In an Airfryer, no oil is necessary, and I can use a few drops of oil on the food they want to fry, and put it in. Within a scheduled time, the food is cooked to one’s perfection and the taste is the same as fried.
So, Innsky airfryer is definitely a very useful gadget. On one hand, it helps cook food without oil. On the other hand it is dishwasher-safe and consumes less fuel than other brands. That makes this product a very beneficial one for those who are worried about their bodies and would want to take care of himself/herself.

So glad that I decided to get this air fryer! This air fryer comes handy when preparing for dinner, not only the side is big enough but it's also so easy to clean after using it. In the package also comes a recipe book which contains various types of food. It is the best purchase!

reviews.reviewTitle: Simply fantastic! EDIT: only 3 uses and plastic tab broke off
reviews.reviewText:
EDIT: I just finished using this for the 3rd time and the plastic tab for the bottom basket came off. This is the tab that slides into sensor to turn on unit when inserting the basket. The machine will not run without this little tab! I have been extra gentle when sliding basket in and out of unit too. this must have already had a crack or was weak....I have requested return and replacement. Will bump the stars back up when it is all resolved.

This thing is HUGE! I tested it out today and it cooked a thick piece of Mahi Mahi PERFECT in around 10 minutes! This is even better than my old AF which recently bit the dust. I am looking forward to using this machine!

My kids always like to eat fried foods so I decided to use this air fryer to make chicken wings and fries. I was surprised with the result. I didn’t use any oils and the food is still crispy. It’s a healthy way to cook food. This air fryer is easy to clean and use. It’s big enough to cook food for the family. Highly recommended.

This is my second one air fryer. I bought that was size 6.3qt. My first one was smaller than this. I like air fryer because that make my cooking time shorter and easy to prepare healthy food to my family. That only use less oil to make yummy food. I am full time working mommy and they help me save lots time on cooking. The reason I bought one larger size air fryer because I could put whole chicken in the pot. It is amazing product to share with you.
had to get a replacement and it still broke. The tab for the basket doesn't seem to last long.

This is my first time trying out the air fryer, I was shock and amaze how easy and simple this cookware, and of course the food taste not as good as the really deep fried, but it is close enough. It come with a recipient book tech you how to cook and the time. So it come in very handy. The capacity is very large I can cook for 4-6serving in there very easy. The quality of the product is great. It is very simple to setup and use. Even my 10yrs old child can make a fresh french fried now. It is safe and simple.

I really like how big this air fryer is and the fact that it has a default temperature and cooking time for food; although you might end up adjusting them a bit. I made chicken thighs in this air fryer last night (see the pictures) and they came out really crispy and delicious! It was the first time I was using an air fryer and based on what I saw in the internet, I didn't wanna put too many pieces in the basket, but now I know that I could've put more pieces. So I made 2 batches and the last picture shows how dirty the basket got at the end! So little mess and so easy to clean. It took about 40 minutes for 2 batches; I think it would've taken maybe half an hr had I put all of them in at once. Anyways, I'm happy with this air fryer and I recommend it :)

Just use this to cook some blue crabs . They came out great and taste yummy ! Love this air fryer , it’s ideally works like small oven ! But it’s much easier to clean it . And for most of the meat and seafood products I don’t put any oil on them , when I cook them with air fryer. Which means it’s healthier. This air fryer has touch screen controls and quite easy to operate. Also the 6.3Qt space is big enough daily use ! No complaints so far :) !

A friend recommended me to try an air fryer since it’s really easy to use and much more convenient. I figured I would trust them and now I think that an air fryer is an essential kitchen appliance. Sure microwaves do their jobs pretty well but more often than not it’s not the same reheating French fries or wings since they won’t be crispy anymore. The air fryer solves all of that. It uses no oil so that’s already a healthy bonus and it’s really versatile in uses. You can basically use it as a second oven since it will cook foods and add that crispness to foods without using the unhealthy addition of oil. You can cook foods like fries, wings, and even steak in this and it’s pretty good. You don’t have to risk burning the house down next time you cook too!

reviews.reviewTitle: I highly highly recommend this product.
reviews.reviewText: This is super beneficial. I don’t know where to start. It makes you food as tasty as deep frying but you don’t have to compromise on test. It’s been more than a month now i am using this and i am loving it. Now, i make almost everything that’s possible in this air-fryer. You can make any types of meat or vegetables. Also, you can make cheese toast or garlic toast or just toast any kind of bread. It is super easy to clean and easy to use.

This air fryer is a lot bigger and holds a lot more food than my other one. So family use is great. The unit is pretty quiet, and makes a lots less heat into the kitchen than with a conventional oven. This air fryer is super easy to use and comes with a recipe book. Even though I didn’t follow many recipes, but it has cooking guidelines on what temperature and how long to cook things. It doesn’t take very long to preheat and you can pause to shake things around in the middle of cooking without losing heat. This air fryer can fit 4 chicken breasts at a time, I haven’t tried to cook a whole chicken yet, but I think it would definitely fit in it. The fryer does a pretty good job air frying frozen foods like french fries, chicken nuggets, fish sticks, even hamburgers with little to no oil added. This air fryer may be great with frozen foods however I'm still trying to get more fresh food recipes to work better. Next, I will try baking a sweet dessert or cake. Anyway, I think this will come in very handy in the summertime in our hot climate as things cook quickly and not a lot of outside heat is generated.

I love this air fryer. I use it everyday. It's easy to clean. I WAS hesitant to purchase it when I read someone's review saying not to purchase it if I ever wanted to clean it. I'm assuming they did not figure out how to take the frying basket out to clean the oil catching pan. So I'll inform you now if you pull the main compartment out and slide the clear tab forward there's a release button there. Push the button and the basket will release. The air fryer is still working like a champ. I looooooooove it.

reviews.reviewTitle: Good air fryer for any food!!! Good NO. 1 choice!!!!

reviews.reviewTitle: Fantastic Air Fryer and Exceptional Customer Service
reviews.reviewText:
I spent a LOT of time researching Air Fryers before deciding on this one. And I'm glad I did! I have loved this Air Fryer from the first day I used it. The tray capacity is big enough for my family. It cooks quickly (without heating up the kitchen) and is simple to use and clean. I air fry all kinds of proteins (chicken breasts, pork loins and chops, steaks, you name it.) And my family likes air-fried frozen French fries even better than deep fried. Win!

But the most impressive part for me was the Customer Service. After I used the AF a couple of times I noticed the tray was difficult to slide into the machine -- it would stick on one side and take multiple tries to get it lined up correctly. It still worked perfectly, but was frustrating to use. I contacted customer service and they replaced the entire machine within days!!! I highly recommend this product, both for the function and the service.

Tried an air fryer for the first time. Looks like a pod from an alien spaceship but it worked pretty well. 😊👌That being said, there are no other negatives. It's so easy to use, cleans super easy, and food comes out sooo good. So far I've made country potatoes and chicken cordon bleu, and my husband raved about how good they were, despite being way lower in fat than how I've previously made these dishes. I can't wait to make wings this weekend!

reviews.reviewTitle: It needs no oil yet food looks and tastes like it was fried.
reviews.reviewText:
I LOVE this air fryer! It needs no oil yet food looks and tastes like it was fried. I made chicken strips and fries only useing a quick spray of coconut oil and they looked and tasted great!
I usually cook these in the oven for 25-30 minutes and they only took about 13 minutes in the air fryer so its also faster.
I like this fryer so much better than my oil fryer because not only did the food taste better it wasn't greasy yet it was crispy and tasted great. The other huge benefit is cleanup was a breeze. No oil to deal with and the removable basket is easy to wash. The black and gold color of the unit makes it look great sitting on the counter. it comes with a cook book，I can't wait to try many more things in this air fryer and think it will become one of my best used kitchen items!

It has some smell when I use it in the first three times, but no problem afterwards. It’s easy to use with many different choices of cooking. The air fry of food are delicious while maintain the cleanliness of kitchen. I tried dumplings, chicken wings and French fries, and they came out great. The big capacity meets the needs of our big family and convenient to prepare meals. Look forward to exploring more food in future.

I did two weeks research of reviews on various air fryers prior to purchasing the Innsky. My first venture was a Cornish Game hen. Total success. It’s a big beast and delivers on all fronts. In particular the cleaning up is a breeze. So much easier than cleaning a whole oven. The kitchen stayed cool. It’s hot outside but not in my kitchen. I have a whole list of recipes to try in the coming weeks. There are plenty of sites on FB with happy users of fryers that will supply you with how to be successful with your AF. At this time I have no negatives to report on the Innsky.

reviews.reviewDate: The manufacturer commented on the review below
reviews.reviewText: We received our air fryer, it would not even turn on. Made the exchange. Was making chicken pulled the holder out, the sensor is right under where u pull it in and out and the plastic piece broke right off as we're cooking dinner. We've had it less than a month. Had a hard time getting the tray out of the machine during unpackaging. I had to shake it a bit to get whatever piece had lodged it close to come loose. Maybe place the small metal accessories in a different area so they dont move around during shipping. Once I got it open it worked great. We have made several things in it and love how crispy things turn out. Was a great price as well considering the size.

I have used this a couple of times for chicken and fresh sweet potato fries. The chicken was good but the fries weren’t as crispy as the should of been but that might of been user error. Still experimenting. This unit doesn’t really give you a lot of instructions on how to use it for different meats, just sitting for your basic meats. So it’s kinda trial and error.
It is super easy to clean and cooks frozen burgers quick and good!

This is the third air fryer that I brought. First one super small Bella, got it from black Friday. Second one I brought Philip. It last for a year. Well I decide not to waste money for another Philip. So I got this Innsky. I just like Philip have modern looking and touch control. And the large size it's good for all family, I never need to cook second time. Plus the dish washer able to make very clean. Don't know how long the non-stick pan will last. But for right now it works great.

I have got this fryer for like almost 2 weeks. After using it for several times. I find out this is very good for a working mother like me who has to both work and taking care of kids. reviews.reviewTitle: Big Size Means More Options to Cook!
reviews.reviewText: This cooker is huge! My wife bought a different air fryer that was on sale at a local store, but I told her that we can get something bigger at Amazon for a better deal. The one she bought was small, so food choices are limited. She was really impressed after I bought this Innsky air fryer cooker. I have included a picture so you can see the difference in size. It's definitely bigger, so we can cook more food! By the way, it comes with a recipe book too if you need any ideas, as well as a rack and skewers (to cook kabobs, for example). It was very easy to use and clean up. I tried to make my own waffle fries for the kids to snack on and they turned out great! The kids loved it. I would recommend this air fryer if you are looking for something with a bigger capacity.

reviews.reviewTitle: We've been using it since the day we got it from the mailbox.
reviews.reviewText:
We had a small air fryer for smaller servings of things like onion rings, sweet potato fries, salmon burgers (which we use more like salmon fritters), and steaks. That was fine when I was making my steak and onion rings lunch, but not so great for when we needed to cook for my husband, too. We needed a larger fryer to handle meals for the two of us at once. I wanted to try roasting a chicken in the air fryer, to see how that would turn out. It was the first thing we tried once we got the Innsky cleaned and set up on the counter. The chicken turned out perfect--succulent moistness, with just enough browning of the skin to make it crispy. Two big steaks? No problem! Toss your steaks into a skillet set at hellfire, flip to char the other side, put them on a grill accessory thingie that we bought separately and two minutes a side later, perfectly medium rare steaks. We reheated leftover coconut shrimp after that, and yum! Turned out perfect, no rubbery breading from a microwave, no overheating our house from turning on the conventional oven or using the stove to reheat.

If you like to cook bigger meals in your fryer, this is definitely a good option. HUGE capacity, enough to cook a whole chicken (up to around 5 pounds), pot roast, personal pizzas, the aforementioned basket of coconut shrimp (around 15?), meat loaf (I have some old mini loaf pans that are deeper than the modern stuff--perfect for the air fryer!), small casseroles, and more, then this is the air fryer for you.

We made room on our utility room shelf to store it when we weren't using it, but it's never been out of use long enough to go there. We probably use it 3 times a week, and it holds up great, cleans up easy. I handwash the basket thingies, and there is a bit of a learning curve with getting around the slots on the sides of the inner basket. Once you get the hang of it, though, it wipes down fast and dries fast, too.

I recommend getting an accessory set to extend the uses you can get out of this air fryer, and open up more possibilities for what to do with it. I use a cake pan from the set I got as a small casserole pan for the husband and me. It makes the right amount for the two of us, with just enough extra for leftovers that we can both have for lunch the next day.

I have been wanting to purchase an air fryer for the longest time but didn’t know if the price was worth it. I wanted to use it to make my kids freshly made chicken strips, French fries, and veggies. This is a much healthier option than pan frying and I’m so happy that I took the plunge and ordered it. Much cheaper than the other ones I saw in the store. Quality is just the same as those much more expensive ones. I’m happy with my purchase and excited to make more things in it. It is larger in size, but that means you have more space to air fry food. Has a larger capacity to cook food too.

reviews.reviewTitle: Easy to use and easy to clean
reviews.reviewText: Prior to purchasing,I’ve always been worried about the products.How could I fry foods without oil? Purchasing the air fryer is probably the best decision I made recently.You can literally use it to fry anything ribs,steaks,cake,etc.If the food doesn’t have fat, spray a little oil on the food. It literally came out the same as using a real deep frying pan.And most amazingly,no grease in your kitchen.This frier was non-stick which makes the washing much easier than thoes silver aluminum pots.The only concern was you might not be able to use dishwasher.(FYI-I have not read the user manual yet.It didn’t look machine washable.) Last,My friend bought a smaller one (4L).Highly recommend this one with large capacity. You don’t want to repeat the same steps every time because you got a smaller air frier.

Initially had a problem with first air fryer and this company provided outstanding customer service and provided a replacement immediately! I love this air fryer. It cooks more evenly than my previous one and food comes out cooked to perfection. I love how easy it is to clean. I also love that it had an incredible 18 month warranty! Thanks again Innsky for your incredible customer service!

I have been thinking to get a air fryer for a while, and I did research on some name brands product for a while. Most of them are quite expensive (more than $200) so Until I visited my friend few weeks ago. She bought this last year and used it really often. The day I visited her family, she cooked some delicious chicken by using this air fryer- I saw she used it, And how food came out. It tasted so good and the cooking process was so easy. I immediately asked her for the link and bought this! I have used it once so far and it was easy to set up, clean!

First time to buy air fryer and figure it out cooking is so easy. Just power on and the displaying menu to show the items to be cooked. Easy to setup temperature and time. Safety is most important, and it makes me comfortable to cook something I was not good at it. I can make BBQ spareribs and yummy food easier. It is easy to clean also. Large capacity can provide big family yummy food. I don’t need to stand to wait for food preparation when I use this air fryer.

I should bought this long time ago. Every eat to use, especially I also bought a chart which tells me the temperature and time I need for all kind of food. I personally love the sweet potato french fries. With 6.3 QT, it is big enough to feed my family. It can dish washer clean. With the LCD touch screen, make it very easy to use. Plus they offer 18 months warranty, it will never go wrong with buying this, if you need it. Highly recommended.

I'm really amazed how this product works. I saw a gordon ramsay video of him using an air fryer to make turkey sliders. I followed his recipe to the tea. Oh boy, first off, Gordon Ramsay is the man! Second, the sliders were amazing! It has that juiciness and exploding flavor in every bite. I'd use this any day over an oven or stove-top. And with the holidays around the corner, I can't wait to use this machine an impress my guest with my cooking!

I was skeptical when my friends told me I had to buy one, but the air fryer has exceeded my expectations.

This is a really great fryer

It works great but the unit is plastic and while I have no complaint about plastic smell, it seems light and for the money I would of thought it would have been more solid. I have tried french frys, both from frozen packaged and just taking a potato and cutting into fries and air frying. The packaged fries seem more like french fries and the cut up potato more like baked potato. It is good, I still need to find through experimentation what works good as far as foods in it. And the oil is not there, but neither is the flavor. How to get the salt to stick to the fries after cooking, just put it in the ketchup. It is easy just set and go play a computer game and come back to eat. Clean up is easy, just rinse and perhaps some soap. It is fairly quiet, and shuts off if I am busy. It is a good sized item on the counter top, so my wifes bread machine which is rarely used is going into storage. The user manual is ok, some things are left to your imagination, but not complex in understanding. I will be trying some vegetables next, like Brussels sprouts, carrots, and onion. It is more a convenience thing than a flavor enhancer, I would think. It is like cooking with a hair dryer. If my initial comments seem so so, I will update comments should I see it more clearly as I perform more experiments in using the thing.
Update: cooking foods like veggies, you need to use foil to keep it from drying out. I should just follow the recipe book, but where is the fun in that?
I love it! Quick, Easy, Less Mess.
Use it all the time.
I use this Night for dinner I wish I had bought it sooner.

qAndA.question: How long does it take to cook a steak?
qAndA.answer:
Preheat the Airfryer to 400°F. Pat steak dry with a paper towel. Add
the steak to the cooking basket and cook for 8-10 minutes for mediumrare.
